title: Classic Carbonara
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta cooks, whisk together eggs, parmesan, cream, and black pepper in a bowl.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add drained pasta and toss.
Remove from heat. Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing vigorously. The residual heat will cook the eggs into a silky sauce.
Add pasta water a splash at a time if needed. Season with salt and serve immediately with extra parmesan.

title: Lemon Herb Chicken
steps: Mix olive oil, lemon juice, honey, minced garlic, salt, and herbs in a bowl.
Coat chicken thighs in the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (or up to overnight).
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Arrange chicken on a sheet pan, skin side up.
Roast for 35-40 minutes until skin is golden and internal temp reaches 165°F.
Rest 5 minutes before serving. Spoon pan juices over the top.

title: Shakshuka
steps: Heat olive oil in a deep skillet. Sauté diced onion and bell pepper until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili flakes. Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, sugar, and salt. Simmer 10 minutes until thickened.
Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook 5-8 minutes until whites are set.
Top with crumbled feta and fresh herbs. Serve with crusty bread.

title: Peanut Noodles
steps: Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, rice vinegar, and sriracha until smooth.
Toss noodles with the peanut sauce until evenly coated.
Add shredded carrots, cucumber, edamame, and chopped scallions.
Garnish with crushed peanuts, sesame seeds, and lime wedges.

title: Mushroom Risotto
steps: Warm broth in a saucepan and keep at a low simmer.
In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté sliced mushrooms until golden. Set aside.
Melt half the butter, add diced onion and cook until translucent. Add rice and toast 2 minutes.
Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring frequently. Wait until each addition is absorbed before adding the next. This takes about 18-20 minutes.
Fold in mushrooms, remaining butter, and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

title: Black Bean Tacos
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add black beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Mash slightly and cook until heated through.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or directly over a gas flame until pliable.
Mix sour cream with lime juice and a pinch of salt for the crema.
Assemble tacos: beans, pickled onion, avocado, crumbled cotija, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime crema and serve with lime wedges.
